item.dc:creator: @sw0o0sh sw0o0sh
item.description:
@sw0o0sh wrote:

Same thing you recommended for my script on txt conversion. Attempt to create a users.username first, grab that insert id, and throw it in for the rscd_players.owner value. If the users.username or rscd_player.username already exists, toss back the user name, or think of something else that’s clever. You could easily make a run once script for this scenario in PHP, given it may take a while, it would work.

item.dc:creator: @darscape darscape
item.description:
@darscape wrote:

When I merged DARScape and King PeeKeeay’s databases, the problem was having players that shared the same user name. I counted up all the players in one database and add +1, then added that to the ID column of each player account in the other database. I then merged them, deleted the duplicates from the database I cared less about, and thus they were merged. Some of the players had high stats in one and low stats in the other and those ended up being overwritten but the items from both accounts merged pretty well and overall it wasn’t so bad. I had to reset a few player’s passwords as they had forgot what they were when they were on the other game with the same username.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @force force
item.description:
@force wrote:

Conflicting names would be a problem but, might be able to deal with this by having accounts migrate over ONLY when someone requests it on the forum…

E.g (You request a account from RSCA it sends a email to the owner of that account… They must accept that request… Once that request is accepted it is transferred over… (only one transfer can occur… Once done it is completely removed from RSCA DB server)…

Tbh I prob wouldn’t both transferring the Forum over… It’d just make a complete mess of the current forum you have unless absolutely EVERYTHING was created in exactly same way (orelse section keys etc wont match) and it will just go to shit…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Zilent Zilent
item.description:
@Zilent wrote:

The only fair way to deal with username conflicts (if neither player is willing to change) that I see is to lock the username so no-one can use it and I suppose literally force (since the original name is locked) both players to pick new usernames (either that or we can use java.util.Random to decide :D). Apart from that, it’s relatively simple I/O to migrate the data together. There are also players who have accounts on both servers (that might have the same names) - in such a case it could be feasible to either take the average of the two accounts and merge them, or simply rename one of the accounts.

The way this would work would not be ‘adding one to the other’, but mixing them both together to come up with a result that is fair to as many combined players as possible. It’s only human nature that both sides feel like they’re being ‘screwed’ out of something, and I suppose that feeling can’t be helped.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Z_Prototype Z Prototype
item.description:
@Z_Prototype wrote:

People are still gonna be pissed. Why not have a button in-game that they can press which will add their account data to a folder? That way you could get a folder only containing accounts that will be used again. Give them a month to press this button otherwise their account is deleted.

force:

The easiest way that I can think of is make a script to mine the data from RSCA and format it correctly to suit RSCE.

this.

Seems like the best way. As for conflicting usernames, find a way to contact both (e-mail perhaps?), and give them both a chance to change usernames, or start over. Then there is the problem of people not checking their e-mail, but in a news post (or something of the sort) make sure its known that if one can’t login, the first thing they should do is check their e-mail.

I suggest making a test Database with test server and forum before you make it live…
